availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James L. Wheeler (Trimble County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, farmer. Oldham County, Kentucky, native. Son of Mary Wheeler. Married to Elizabeth Bain Wheeler in Trimble County on March 5, 1857. Farmer in Trimble County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Trimble County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Trimble County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, District 1, p. 409B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, p. 202.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trimble County Marriages.
Find A Grave, "James L. Wheeler (1828-1928)," Memorial #88906094, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88906094 (accessed August 24, 2020)
